intro: Royena falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rosy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are five-petaled and bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
